\subsection{Detailed Description}
A label class that does not have letters as content such as \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol}{GSymbol}, but pictures coming from png files 

\subsection{Constructor \& Destructor Documentation}
\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GPictureSymbol_aac73ebde57146de0bbb6724833c53cf8}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::GPictureSymbol@{OpenViBEApplications::GPictureSymbol}!GPictureSymbol@{GPictureSymbol}}
\index{GPictureSymbol@{GPictureSymbol}!OpenViBEApplications::GPictureSymbol@{OpenViBEApplications::GPictureSymbol}}
\subsubsection[{GPictureSymbol}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}GPictureSymbol::GPictureSymbol (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{OpenViBE::CString}]{sourcePath, }
\item[{OpenViBE::float32}]{scaleSize}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GPictureSymbol_aac73ebde57146de0bbb6724833c53cf8}
has to create a texture manager to make sure all buttons that use the same picture use the same resource in graphical memory so that no multiple textures of the same pic are created\par
 On top of that it also uses display lists managed by \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1OpenGLDListManager}{OpenGLDListManager}, both are created by the super class \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel}{GLabel}. One display list is filled in by \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel}{GLabel}, the other one by this class 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em sourcePath} & the file name of the png file that will be used to make the texture \\
\hline
{\em scaleSize} & a number between 0 and 1 that defines the size of the texture in the button box \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GPictureSymbol_aa6018be99bc4605f4a70164d40fd0a71}{
